p: Evaluation of GPx activity in tissue homogenate was carried out following the method of Rotruck et al. (1973). Exactly 500 μL of tissue homogenate was added to 250 mL of 0.2 M phosphate buffer (pH 8.0), 50 μL sodium azide (10 mM), 100 mL GSH (4.0 mM), 50 μL H 2O 2 (2.5 mM), and 500 mL of distilled water. Reaction mixtures were incubated for 3 min at room temperature; 50 μL of 10% trichloroacetic acid was then added, mixed, and the mixture was centrifuged for 10 min at 3,000 rpm. The supernatant (50 μL) was then added 450 μL 0.3 M disodium hydrogen phosphate buffer (pH 7.4) and 500 mL of freshly prepared 0.6 mM dithiobisnitro-benzoate in 0.2 M sodium phosphate buffer, pH 8.0. The absorbance was read at 412 nm against blank (prepared by replacing homogenates with distilled water).
